Eli Manning Reflects on Career and Excitement for Drew Brees vs. Tom Brady Matchup

Former New York Giants quarterback, Eli Manning, recently took the time to reflect on his illustrious career and share his perspectives on the current NFL playoffs. Manning, a two-time Super Bowl winner who famously defeated Tom Brady and the New England Patriots in both championship games, remains closely connected to the football world even after retiring from the game.

As the NFL playoffs heat up, Manning expresses his excitement about the upcoming Drew Brees vs. Tom Brady matchup in the NFC Divisional round. Manning, who knows both legendary quarterbacks well from his playing days, is eager to witness the clash of these titans on the field once again.

Since stepping away from the gridiron, Manning has chosen to keep a lower public profile compared to his brother, Peyton Manning. However, he has been actively involved in charity work and brand endorsements, using his platform to make a positive impact off the field.

One of Manning's recent endeavors includes collaborating with his former teammate Victor Cruz on Stella Stadium Bites, an initiative aimed at providing innovative and delicious food ideas for the Super Bowl. Manning and Cruz, who shared memorable moments on the field together, are now teaming up to enhance the Super Bowl experience for football fans everywhere.

Reflecting on his intense rivalry with Tom Brady, Manning emphasizes the importance of teamwork in their Super Bowl victories. Despite Brady's individual accolades, Manning credits the collective effort of the entire team for overcoming formidable opponents like the Patriots on the biggest stage in football.

When discussing the strategy against teams like the Patriots, Manning stresses the significance of playing smart football and executing well under pressure. His experiences in high-stakes games have taught him valuable lessons that he carries with him even in retirement.

Manning also sheds light on his relationship with his brother, Peyton Manning, revealing that they frequently engage in football conversations and analysis. The Manning brothers share a deep bond rooted in their love for the game, often exchanging insights and supporting each other both on and off the field.

Despite being considered the quieter Manning brother, Eli cherishes memories of watching Super Bowls with his family and acknowledges the profound impact those moments have had on his life and career. The Manning family's passion for football runs deep, and those shared experiences continue to shape Eli's perspective on the game.

Eli Manning expresses gratitude for the opportunity to collaborate with Victor Cruz on Super Bowl-related activities beyond his playing days. Their partnership exemplifies the enduring camaraderie formed through their time together as teammates and friends.

Finally, Manning commends the longevity and skill of both Drew Brees and Tom Brady as they defy age and continue to perform at a high level well into their 40s. Manning's admiration for their dedication and talent underscores the respect he holds for his fellow quarterbacks who continue to inspire on the field.

Chaos and Condemnation: Capitol Riot Sparks Outrage and Resignations

Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle have come together to condemn the violence that erupted during the Capitol riot on January 6th, 2021. While many denounced the actions of the rioters as an attack on democracy, some individuals controversially referred to them as "patriots", sparking heated debates in political circles.

The chaos that unfolded at the Capitol was emboldened by President Donald Trump and several Republican rally attendees, including state lawmakers. One GOP state lawmaker has even resigned from his position after attending the rally that preceded the violent insurrection in Washington, D.C.

The rally's primary purpose was to support Trump's baseless claims of election fraud and his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election. The event drew in Republican lawmakers, further stoking the flames of dissent and defiance against the certified election outcome.

Rioters, incited by Trump's rhetoric, organized an attempted coup on the Capitol building as Congress gathered to formalize President-elect Joe Biden's victory. Investigations into the incident are ongoing, with the tragic event resulting in at least five deaths, including that of a police officer.

Reports have emerged suggesting that members of the Proud Boys, a classified hate group, were among the rioters present at the scene. Amid the chaos, a Senate aide heroically secured the electoral vote boxes, ensuring their safety and preventing any damage during the unrest.

Despite the unprecedented breach of the Capitol, the vote to certify Joe Biden's win resumed hours later, signaling a resilient display of democratic resolve. Trump, facing mounting pressure, promised a peaceful transition of power in the wake of the turmoil.

Calls for Trump's impeachment on charges of "incitement of an insurrection" have since gained traction, with a growing backlash directed at Republican lawmakers who actively participated in the rally and potentially fueled the violent events that unfolded.

New York Attorney General Reveals Shocking Underreporting of COVID-19 Nursing Home Deaths

New York Attorney General Letitia James has dropped a bombshell on the state's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, revealing that the Department of Health may have severely underreported nursing home deaths by as much as 50%. This revelation has cast a harsh light on Governor Andrew Cuomo's controversial directive that forced nursing homes to accept COVID-19 patients, contributing to a devastating death toll among elderly residents.

The Cuomo administration's policy, combined with the underreported death toll, has sparked outrage and criticism from various quarters. Media critic William A. Jacobson, a professor at Cornell Law School, was among those who blasted CNN for allowing Gov. Cuomo to appear multiple times on his brother Chris Cuomo's show without addressing the nursing home issue. The perceived conflict of interest and mishandling of the coverage did not go unnoticed by commentators.

Journalist Glenn Greenwald and other media watchdogs have also been highly critical of CNN's handling of the Cuomo brothers' interviews, accusing the network of enabling Gov. Cuomo to evade tough questions about the nursing home scandal. Despite mounting pressure, when the topic was finally broached on CNN, Gov. Cuomo deflected criticism in a lighthearted manner, further fueling the backlash.

In response to the allegations, Gov. Cuomo shifted blame to the Trump administration for the state's pandemic-related failings and staunchly defended his nursing home policy. Prior to the scandal, Cuomo had been hailed by the liberal media, even penning a book on leadership and receiving an Emmy Award for his TV briefings during the pandemic.

The attorney general's report suggested that the mandatory admission of COVID-19 patients into nursing homes may have significantly increased the risk to residents, potentially contributing to the staggering death toll. Media commentators on both sides of the political divide have condemned the coverage and handling of the Cuomo nursing home controversy.

Letitia James, the New York Attorney General, emphasized the severity of the situation, stating, "The public deserves a complete and accurate picture of what happened in nursing homes and long-term care facilities during the pandemic." Her revelations have sparked renewed calls for accountability and transparency in the state's official reporting of COVID-19 data.

William A. Jacobson, as a media critic, criticized CNN for its handling of the Cuomo interviews, pointing out the glaring conflict of interest in allowing the brothers to engage in lighthearted banter while dodging serious questions about the nursing home deaths.
Glenn Greenwald joined the chorus of voices condemning CNN's coverage, highlighting the network's failure to hold Gov. Cuomo accountable for his actions during the pandemic.

Former CNN digital producer and media watchdog Steve Krakauer echoed the sentiments of many critics, questioning the network's journalistic integrity in its handling of the Cuomo brothers' interviews. The controversy surrounding Gov. Cuomo's leadership during the pandemic continues to raise important questions about media ethics and responsible reporting.

Press Release: President Biden's COVID-19 Strategy Leads to 300 Million Vaccine Doses Administered in 150 Days

Washington D.C. â€“ Under President Biden's leadership, the United States has achieved a significant milestone in the fight against COVID-19, with the administration's strategy resulting in the administration of 300 million vaccine doses in just 150 days. This swift and effective vaccination campaign has played a crucial role in lowering COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths across the country.

When President Biden took office, only 5% of adult Americans were vaccinated, and the initial pace of vaccinations was slow. Now, more than 175 million Americans have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, with 65% of adult Americans having received at least one shot and 55% fully vaccinated.

The Biden Administration's comprehensive efforts to combat the pandemic have included securing vaccine supply, increasing vaccination sites, and mobilizing federal personnel for vaccinations. Over 81,000 vaccination sites have been established, ensuring that Americans can easily access vaccines within 5 miles of their residences.

Furthermore, the federal pharmacy vaccination program has expanded to 42,000 local pharmacies, where over 82 million shots have been administered. Additionally, 39 federally-run, high-volume vaccination sites have been set up, with a particular focus on reaching vulnerable neighborhoods.

Community health centers have played a crucial role in ensuring vaccine access for underserved populations, including those living at or below the poverty line and racial/ethnic minorities. These centers have hosted almost 11,000 pop-up clinics, making vaccines more accessible to those who need them most.

The Biden Administration has made equity a top priority in its vaccination efforts, ensuring that a majority of federally-provided shots have gone to people of color. Moreover, the administration has supported over 20,000 community-based pop-up vaccination clinics, furthering its commitment to reaching all communities across the nation.

As a result of these concerted efforts, the United States is making significant progress in the fight against COVID-19, with vaccination rates steadily climbing and the number of cases, hospitalizations, and deaths on the decline. President Biden's steadfast leadership in this crisis has been instrumental in guiding the nation toward a safer and healthier future.

For more information on vaccination locations and eligibility criteria, please visit www.cdc.gov or contact your local health department.

House Democrats Move Towards Second Impeachment of President Trump Post-Capitol Attack

Following the violent insurrection at the Capitol last week, House Democrats are swiftly heading towards impeaching President Trump for the second time. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi underlined the urgency of the situation in a letter to her colleagues, describing Trump as an "imminent threat" to democracy and the Constitution. Among the measures being explored is adopting a resolution invoking the 25th Amendment, championed by Rep. Jamie Raskin, to urge Vice President Pence to intervene and remove Trump from office.

Speaker Pelosi and Senate Minority Leader Charles Schumer sought to engage with Vice President Pence on the matter but failed to connect, as per reports. The drafted articles of impeachment center on Trump's alleged incitement of the violent siege on the Capitol, aiming to put them to a vote as early as Wednesday. However, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has indicated that a trial in the Senate might not commence before President-elect Biden's inauguration, which could impact the new administration's initial outreach.

While President-elect Biden has refrained from publicly expressing his stance on impeachment, focusing on his upcoming policy priorities, some GOP members have indicated openness to the idea. Senator Ben Sasse has been vocal in his criticism, stating, "The House, if they come together and have a process, I will definitely consider whatever articles they might move." Nonetheless, others like McConnell have maintained their silence following the attack, leaving their positions unclear in this fluid political environment.

Amid discussions to prevent potential hindrances to Biden's early presidency, lawmakers are contemplating strategies such as delaying the transmission of the impeachment articles to the Senate. This course of action could potentially avert conflicting with the initial days of the Biden administration, as additional measures, including censure of Trump and actions against GOP members who objected to the Electoral College results, are being weighed.

Representative James Clyburn emphasized the significance of holding Trump accountable, stating, "This man was elected to the presidency of the United States. He should not be allowed to get away with installing and inciting insurrection against the United States." Delegate Eleanor Holmes Norton echoed the sentiment, delineating the importance of not tolerating actions that undermine democracy.

On the Republican side, Senators Lisa Murkowski, Pat Toomey, and Roy Blunt have signaled varying degrees of concern, indicating a potential shift towards supporting impeachment measures. However, Senators Josh Hawley and Ted Cruz, who both faced criticism for objecting to the certification of the Electoral College results, continue to face scrutiny from their colleagues.

Senator Sheldon Whitehouse emphasized the need for accountability, asserting, "The President set the mob on the Capitol. His lack of action for hours heightened danger, as did his calls to a number of Republicans asking for delay in the confirmation of election results." Senator Chris Coons stressed the gravity of the situation, noting, "This is an assault on our constitutional process and our democracy."

Representative Cori Bush highlighted the urgency of the moment, emphasizing that action must be taken swiftly, stating, "Every hour that Donald Trump remains in power is a clear and present danger to the country, and we must take immediate action." The resolution to hold Trump accountable for his role in the Capitol attack is set to dominate the political landscape in the days leading up to Biden's inauguration.

Archbishop of Canterbury confirms Meghan and Harry's legal marriage status

CNN - The Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, has confirmed that the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, were not legally married before their public ceremony. This revelation comes after Meghan disclosed in an interview with Oprah Winfrey that the couple had a private exchange of vows three days before their widely publicized wedding.

During the interview, Meghan shared that the private ceremony did not have any witnesses present, which has sparked speculation about its legal validity. However, Archbishop Welby clarified that he signed the legal document on the day of their grand wedding at St. George's Chapel in Windsor on May 19, 2018. He noted that signing a false wedding certificate would have constituted a serious criminal offense.

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle officially tied the knot at the public ceremony at St. George's Chapel, which was attended by guests from around the world. This event was widely covered by the media and was seen as a significant moment in the royal couple's relationship.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex made headlines last year when they announced their decision to step back from their roles as senior members of the royal family. In their interview with Oprah, the couple delved into the reasons behind their departure, shedding light on the challenges they faced within the royal institution.

One of the most shocking revelations from the interview was Meghan's disclosure about concerns within the royal family regarding the skin color of their son, Archie, before he was born. This revelation brought to light issues of racism and discrimination that the couple faced during their time as working royals.

The candid interview with Oprah allowed Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to speak openly about their experiences within the royal family, including Meghan's struggles with mental health and the lack of support she felt she received. The couple's decision to step back from royal duties and pursue a more independent path has since sparked discussions about the future of the monarchy and the challenges faced by its members.

As the Duke and Duchess of Sussex continue to navigate their new roles outside of the royal family, their interview with Oprah has provided a platform for them to address issues of race, mental health, and family dynamics in a way that was not possible while they were still working members of the monarchy.

Kamala Harris Makes History as First Female Vice President

WASHINGTON (AP) â€“ Kamala Harris made history on Wednesday as she was sworn in as the first female Vice President of the United States. In a groundbreaking moment, Harris also became the first Black woman and first person of South Asian descent to hold the office, breaking barriers and inspiring millions across the nation.

In her remarks at the Lincoln Memorial, Harris highlighted the significance of the moment, stating that her inauguration exemplified "American aspiration." She emphasized the diversity of America and the opportunities the country holds for everyone, regardless of their background.

Sworn in by Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor, Harris took the oath of office using a Bible that once belonged to Thurgood Marshall, the first Black Supreme Court Justice. She was escorted to the podium by Capitol Police Officer Eugene Goodman, who was hailed as a hero for his actions during the Capitol riots.

Harris' inauguration is being regarded as a significant milestone in American history, symbolizing progress in both gender and racial equality. Her diverse background is seen as a reflection of many Americans' stories and is expected to bring vital perspectives to the new administration.

The Vice President assumed her role in the Senate for the first time, presiding over the chamber and swearing in three new Democratic senators as her first official duty. Prior to her Vice Presidency, Harris served as a Senator from California and had also run for the presidency herself during the Democratic primaries.

Members of the Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority, of which Harris is a member, celebrated her historic inauguration. Elizabeth Shelby, a member of the sorority, expressed her pride, stating, "It's a very beautiful moment in history. To have a woman of color as Vice President is just empowering for little girls all over the country."

President Joe Biden acknowledged the significance of Harris' election in his inaugural address, marking it as a historic step forward for the nation. Experts believe that Harris' vice presidency will redefine political power in America and underscore the importance of Black women's leadership in shaping the future of the country.

Lateefah Simon, a civil rights advocate and friend of Harris, praised the Vice President's historic achievement, saying, "Kamala Harris is Black excellence. She is our opportunity to showcase what it means to be challenged but to rise above it." Simon emphasized the symbolic importance of Harris' election for communities of color across the U.S.

Martha S. Jones, a professor of history at Johns Hopkins University, highlighted the broader implications of Harris' inauguration, stating that it represents a significant moment in the ongoing struggle for gender and racial equality in America. Jones noted that Harris' rise to the Vice Presidency signals a shift in the traditional power structures and sets a new precedent for diverse leadership in the country.

As Kamala Harris takes on her role as the Vice President of the United States, her historic inauguration serves as a beacon of hope and progress for many, inspiring a new chapter in American politics that embraces diversity and inclusivity for all.

Trash Parade Draws Attention to New Orleans Garbage Crisis Post-Hurricane Ida

Residents of New Orleans are grappling with a growing garbage crisis as piles of uncollected trash line the streets for weeks after Hurricane Ida wreaked havoc on the city. Residents, who have been dealing with the issue since before the hurricane struck on August 29, voiced their frustrations to a City Council committee.

Among those frustrated residents is Aaron "Louisiana" Grant, who proposed a unique solution to draw attention to the ongoing garbage collection problems â€“ a Trash Parade. Grant took to Facebook with his idea, which was intended as a satirical protest to highlight the city's failed sanitation services. The event quickly gained traction, with over 1,900 interested participants showing support for the initiative.

Approximately 150 protesters, embracing creativity and ingenuity, came together to participate in the Trash Parade. Donning imaginative costumes and wielding clever signs, the demonstrators marched through the streets, aiming to bring awareness to the dire situation the city is facing post-Ida. Grant, the brains behind the inventive protest, sees humor as a coping mechanism for residents trying to navigate the challenges in the aftermath of the disaster.

Despite the attention garnered by the Trash Parade, the garbage collection issues persist in New Orleans, with trash remaining visible throughout the city. Mayor LaToya Cantrell acknowledged the severity of the situation, attributing the ongoing problems to a workforce shortage that has been exacerbated by the impact of Hurricane Ida. In response to the crisis, the city is actively seeking assistance from outside contractors to address the sanitation challenges plaguing New Orleans.

Aaron Grant, in his criticism of the local government's handling of the sanitation crisis, points to a lack of proper planning and preparation for such emergencies. Grant highlights the discrepancy between the swift assistance received by other sectors, such as electrical and healthcare services, in the aftermath of Ida, and the lack of support provided to the vital sanitation services that are crucial for the city's well-being.

Grant, emphasizing the need for urgent action to resolve the garbage crisis, calls on local authorities to prioritize this essential service that directly impacts the health and quality of life of New Orleans residents. As the city continues to grapple with the aftermath of Hurricane Ida, the Trash Parade stands as a vivid reminder of the pressing need for immediate and effective solutions to address the mounting garbage woes in the city.

Impeached Again: Trump Faces Historic Bipartisan Rebuke

WASHINGTON (AP) â€“ President Donald Trump has made history by becoming the first U.S. president to be impeached twice. The U.S. House charged him with 'incitement of insurrection' following the violent attack on the U.S. Capitol by his supporters.

The impeachment vote of 232-197, with ten Republicans breaking ranks to join Democrats, marked a significant bipartisan rebuke. This move represents the most bipartisan presidential impeachment in modern times, highlighting the gravity of the situation and the widespread condemnation of Trump's actions.

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi emphasized the urgency of the moment during the debate, saying there was a 'clear and present danger' posed by Trump. Pelosi urged lawmakers to fulfill their constitutional duties and uphold the rule of law in the face of the violent events at the Capitol.

In response to the impeachment, Trump released a video statement denouncing the violence and calling for unity but made no mention of the impeachment proceedings brought against him. Meanwhile, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell acknowledged that Trump committed impeachable offenses but has not indicated how he intends to vote on the matter.

The impeachment resolution is centered on Trump's role in inciting the mob that disrupted the certification of the presidential election results. It draws heavily on Trump's inflammatory rhetoric and his persistent falsehoods about the election outcome that ultimately fueled the violent breach of the Capitol.

Security measures at the Capitol have been tightened, including the installation of metal detectors for House members, reflecting heightened concerns about safety and potential threats. Lawmakers have been on edge following the unprecedented breach of the Capitol by insurrectionists.

During the House debate, Democratic Representative Jim McGovern stated, "We are debating this historic measure at an actual crime scene." Representative Jason Crow added, "We are taught all our lives that our democracy is a fragile thing. It turns out they were right."

Republican Representative Tom McClintock argued against impeachment, warning that doing so would set a dangerous precedent. "The abuse, the weaponization of impeachment will be so much more damaging than the actions in question," he expressed.

Republican Senators Pat Toomey and Lisa Murkowski have called on Trump to resign. While Toomey stated that Trump's resignation would be the best path forward, Murkowski emphasized that she believes he should leave office as soon as possible.

House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy expressed opposition to impeachment but did acknowledge Trump's responsibility in the Capitol siege. However, Third-ranking House GOP leader Liz Cheney took a strong stance, saying, "There has never been a greater betrayal by a President of the United States of his office and his oath to the Constitution."

Tom Brady's Pursuit of Super Bowl Records at Super Bowl 55

As Tom Brady prepares to play in his tenth Super Bowl, the NFL legend continues to cement his legacy as one of the greatest quarterbacks in the history of the league. With six Super Bowl wins to his name, Brady is no stranger to the biggest stage in American sports and will be aiming to add another Vince Lombardi Trophy to his collection as he leads the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Super Bowl 55.

Brady's illustrious career is marked by numerous records and accolades, making him a household name in the world of American football. Widely considered the most successful quarterback in NFL history, Brady's impact on the game is undeniable. Despite his age (43), he has shown no signs of slowing down and remains a force to be reckoned with on the field.

While Brady's influence on the Buccaneers has been evident in their journey to Super Bowl 55, it is worth noting that the team's postseason success prior to his arrival was relatively modest. However, Brady's leadership and experience have undoubtedly elevated the team's performance, guiding them to the pinnacle of the sport.

In the realm of Super Bowl records, Brady stands head and shoulders above his peers. With six Super Bowl wins under his belt, he holds the record for most championships won by a single player. Additionally, Brady has played in nine Super Bowls, another record that showcases his longevity and consistency at the highest level of competition.

Brady's MVP accolades in the Super Bowl are equally impressive, with four to his name, underscoring his ability to deliver in clutch moments and lead his team to victory on the grandest stage in American sports.

When it comes to statistics, Brady's dominance is unparalleled. He holds multiple Super Bowl records including most pass attempts, pass completions, completion percentage in a single game, passing yards, and touchdown passes in the history of the game. These records serve as a testament to his skill, precision, and ability to perform under pressure when it matters most.

As Brady gears up for Super Bowl 55, he has the opportunity to break even more records and further solidify his status as one of the all-time greats. If the Buccaneers emerge victorious, Brady will claim sole possession of the most NFL championships won by a player, breaking the tie with other legendary figures in the sport.

Another record within Brady's reach at Super Bowl 55 is the most touchdown passes thrown in a single Super Bowl. His personal best currently stands at four, which ranks third all-time behind Steve Young's record of six. Should Brady have a standout performance in the upcoming game, he could potentially rewrite the record books once again.

On the flip side, interceptions are a blemish in Brady's otherwise stellar Super Bowl career. With six interceptions thrown in his Super Bowl appearances, Brady ranks fourth all-time in this category. Surprisingly, despite playing in nearly twice as many Super Bowls as John Elway, Brady trails the Denver Broncos legend in total interceptions thrown in the big game.

As the countdown to Super Bowl 55 continues, all eyes will be on Tom Brady and his quest to etch his name even deeper into the annals of NFL history. With the potential to break multiple records and add another Super Bowl title to his resume, Brady's legacy as a football icon is set to grow even further. Whatever the outcome of the game, one thing is certain: Tom Brady's impact on the sport transcends generations and solidifies his place as a true legend in the world of American football.

Former CNN Producer Indicted for Allegedly Luring Minors for Sexual Exploitation

John Griffin, a former CNN producer, is facing serious legal trouble after being accused of luring minors for unlawful sexual activities. Griffin allegedly offered significant sums of money to women and their daughters for sexual acts, including incidents that took place in the presence of minors. The ex-producer is now indicted on charges of attempting to sexually exploit minors, with each of the three counts involving a 9-year-old girl carrying a possible sentence of up to 10 years in prison.

US Attorney Nikolas P. Kerest stressed the importance of keeping Griffin detained for the safety of the community, noting his wealth and desperation to evade justice. Kerest expressed concern over Griffin's actions, particularly his disturbing communications, which reportedly included reassuring an individual who had sexually assaulted a baby. Prosecutors further alleged that Griffin offered money for 'sexual subservience' training sessions at his Vermont ski house, targeting girls as young as 9 years old.

Griffin's sordid activities extended to involving others in his schemes, as evidenced by the arrest of Heather Carriker. Carriker stands accused of participating in the abuse of her own daughters at Griffin's residence. The shocking allegations came to light through explicit text messages that were discovered by one victim's biological mother, shedding light on the heinous acts perpetrated by Griffin and his associates.

In a bid to manipulate the legal process, Griffin attempted to leverage his wealth, offering a family member of a victim a payoff of $4,000. This brazen move underscores the lengths to which Griffin was willing to go to avoid the consequences of his actions. Despite previously enjoying privileges due to his financial status, the former CNN producer now faces significant legal penalties and reputational risks as a result of the serious allegations against him.

As the case against Griffin unfolds, authorities are working diligently to ensure that justice is served and that the victims receive the support they need. The indictment paints a troubling picture of exploitation and abuse, highlighting the importance of holding perpetrators accountable for their crimes. With the evidence against him mounting, Griffin's future hangs in the balance as he navigates the legal proceedings that await him.

Forensic Experts Criticize LA Sheriff's Department for Quick Ruling on Tiger Woods Crash

Forensic experts have raised concerns over the handling of Tiger Woods' recent car crash by the LA County Sheriff's Department, calling into question the hasty conclusion of the incident as an 'accident' without a thorough investigation into potential impairment. The controversy stems from Sheriff Alex Villanueva's statement the day of the crash, where he declared there was "no evidence of impairment" in Woods' driving.

Charles Schack, President of Crash Experts, pointed out that the lack of skid marks at the scene and Woods' own statement that he could not remember driving suggest the possibility of inattentiveness or impairment. Schack added, "It's essential to consider all possibilities in such cases, especially when high-profile individuals are involved. Rushing to dismiss potential impairment can hinder a comprehensive understanding of the situation."

Accident reconstruction experts have noted that the absence of braking or attempts to steer away from the crash site could indicate a lack of attention or impairment on Woods' part. Jonathan Cherney, a former detective, commented, "Based on the available information, it appears that Tiger Woods may have fallen asleep at the wheel, leading to the crash. This scenario is common in cases where drivers are fatigued or under the influence of substances."

One of the recommended protocols in such cases is the involvement of a drug recognition expert (DRE) to assess any signs of impairment. Chris Taylor, Managing Attorney at Taylor & Taylor, explained, "A DRE is trained to evaluate a driver's medications, eyes, and vital signs to determine potential impairment. If deemed necessary, a blood test can be administered to identify any substances in the driver's system, which could lead to charges of misdemeanor driving under the influence."

Unfortunately, obtaining Woods' blood and medical reports at this point is challenging without his cooperation or a search warrant. Due to the delay in conducting a thorough investigation at the scene, crucial evidence that could have shed light on Woods' condition at the time of the crash may now be inaccessible.

While the sheriff's department has retrieved data from the SUV's 'black box,' which records various parameters such as speed and braking, they have not disclosed their findings to the public. This leaves many unanswered questions surrounding the circumstances of the crash and Woods' potential state of mind while driving.

In light of the criticism surrounding the handling of the case, Sheriff Alex Villanueva defended his department's actions, stating, "We follow standardized procedures in such incidents and based on the evidence at the scene, we did not find any indication of impairment in Mr. Woods' driving. Our priority is to ensure a fair and thorough investigation."

Despite the sheriff's reassurances, the controversy surrounding Tiger Woods' crash raises broader concerns about the procedures followed in high-profile incidents and the importance of a detailed examination of all possible factors contributing to such accidents. As the investigation continues, the focus remains on uncovering the truth behind the circumstances leading to the crash and ensuring accountability where necessary.

Biden Tours Hurricane Ida's Aftermath, Calls for Urgent Action on Climate Change

President Joe Biden recently toured flood-ravaged areas in New Jersey and is set to visit New York City to assess the damage caused by Hurricane Ida. During his visit, Biden stressed the urgent need for action on climate change and its role in exacerbating extreme weather events.

"We can't turn it back very much, but we can prevent it from getting worse," Biden stated, pointing to the impact of climate change on the intensity of storms like Hurricane Ida. He called for swift action to address the root causes of climate change and protect communities from future disasters.

In response to the devastation caused by Hurricane Ida, President Biden has approved major disaster declarations for several counties in New Jersey and New York. This declaration paves the way for federal assistance to support recovery efforts in these hard-hit areas.

Hurricane Ida made landfall in Louisiana as a powerful Category 4 storm before moving northeast, unleashing widespread flooding and destruction along its path. The storm's impact was felt across the Eastern United States, claiming over 50 lives in six states due to record rainfall and catastrophic flooding.

Biden's visit to the affected regions aims to push for increased federal investment in infrastructure to better protect communities from the escalating threat of climate-related disasters. The President highlighted the need to build more resilient infrastructure that can withstand the impact of extreme weather events.

"The intensity of storms, the more storms we have, the more likely it is one of them is going to be a really bad one," Biden emphasized, underscoring the increasing frequency of severe weather events across the country.

New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy echoed Biden's concerns, indicating that the clean-up and rebuilding efforts in the state would be a lengthy process. "This is not going to be overnight. This is going to be a slog over the next number of months," Governor Murphy remarked, recognizing the scale of the challenges ahead.

Prior to his visit to the Northeast, President Biden had traveled to Louisiana to assess the damages from Hurricane Ida's initial landfall. The White House has been closely monitoring the situation and coordinating federal support to assist states affected by the storm.

White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki highlighted the broad impact of severe weather events on communities across the United States. "These are reminders that they [storms] are a stark reminder that more frequent and intense storms have an impact on people across the country," Psaki noted, emphasizing the need for proactive measures to address the climate crisis.

As the cleanup and recovery efforts continue in the wake of Hurricane Ida, policymakers at both the federal and state levels are grappling with the long-term implications of climate change on extreme weather events. President Biden's visits to the affected areas underline the pressing need for coordinated action to mitigate the impact of future disasters and safeguard vulnerable communities.

The End of an Era: U.S. Troops Leave Afghanistan, Closing America's Longest War

Aug 30 (Reuters) â€“ After two decades of military engagement, the last U.S. troops departed Afghanistan, marking the end of America's longest war. The withdrawal came nearly 20 years after U.S. forces entered the country in response to the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks orchestrated by al Qaeda from Afghan soil.

The U.S. involvement in Afghanistan began on October 7, 2001, with airstrikes targeting the Taliban regime and al Qaeda militants. However, the initial military operations did not involve significant combat deployments. In December 2001, Osama bin Laden, the mastermind of the 9/11 attacks, managed to escape U.S. bombing in the Tora Bora region of Afghanistan, fleeing to Pakistan.

By May 2, 2003, major combat operations in Afghanistan were declared over, as the focus shifted towards Iraq. This shift allowed the Taliban to regroup and mount a resurgence in Afghanistan. In February 2009, President Obama ordered an increase in U.S. troops, with numbers exceeding 100,000 by 2010, to conduct counter-insurgency operations in the country.

The operation to eliminate bin Laden culminated on May 1, 2011, when U.S. forces successfully targeted and killed the al Qaeda leader in Pakistan. Following this milestone, the U.S. initiated a drawdown in Afghanistan in May 2014, focusing on training the Afghan military and planning for a full withdrawal by the end of 2016.

In a significant development on Feb. 29, 2020, the Trump administration signed an agreement with the Taliban, paving the way for the withdrawal of U.S. troops in exchange for the Taliban's commitment to negotiate peace with the Afghan government. FDA and CDC Lift Recommended Pause on Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 Vaccine in the U.S.

The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have announced the lifting of the recommended pause on the use of the Johnson & Johnson (Janssen) COVID-19 vaccine in the United States following a thorough safety review. This decision comes after the agencies initially recommended the pause in the administration of the vaccine due to six reported cases of a rare and severe type of blood clot known as thrombosis-thrombocytopenia syndrome (TTS).

During the temporary pause, medical and scientific teams within the FDA and CDC conducted a comprehensive review of the available data, assessed the potential risks associated with the vaccine, and engaged in outreach efforts to healthcare providers to ensure they were informed about the situation.

Dr. Janet Woodcock, Acting FDA Commissioner, emphasized that the safety of vaccines remains a top priority, stating, "We have concluded that the known and potential benefits of the Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine outweigh its known and potential risks in individuals 18 years of age and older." She also highlighted the robust monitoring systems in place to continue assessing the vaccine's safety.

According to the updated guidance, the data suggest that the risk of developing TTS after receiving the Johnson & Johnson vaccine is very low. Individuals who receive the vaccine, as well as healthcare providers administering it, are encouraged to review the revised fact sheets, which now include information on the risk of TTS.

The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) has reviewed the latest data related to TTS and the Johnson & Johnson vaccine. Dr. Rochelle P. Walensky, CDC Director, underlined the effectiveness of the vaccine safety monitoring systems in place and encouraged individuals to consult with their healthcare providers if they have any questions or concerns about the vaccine.

Dr. Walensky stated, "The ACIP has reviewed the latest data and recommends that the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine be used for persons 18 years of age and older in the United States population under the FDA's Emergency Use Authorization." She emphasized the importance of continuing to monitor the safety of all COVID-19 vaccines.

Since the authorization of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, a total of 15 cases of TTS have been reported to the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS), all of which were in women aged between 18 and 59 years. The agencies will continue to monitor reports of adverse events closely and take action as necessary.

In conclusion, the FDA and CDC are confident in the safety and efficacy of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine and have lifted the recommended pause on its use. Individuals are encouraged to get vaccinated to protect themselves and their communities from the spread of COVID-19, and healthcare providers are urged to educate their patients about the benefits and risks of vaccination.

For more information, individuals can visit the FDA and CDC websites or speak to their healthcare providers. The agencies will continue to closely monitor the safety of all authorized COVID-19 vaccines and provide updates as needed.

FDA Authorizes Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Booster for 16- and 17-Year-Olds

Today, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) expanded eligibility for the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 booster shot to include adolescents aged 16 and 17 years old. This decision comes after a thorough evaluation of data showing the potential benefits of a single booster dose following the primary Pfizer-BioNTech vaccination regimen in this age group. The booster dose is authorized for administration at least six months after completion of the primary Pfizer-BioNTech vaccination series.

Acting FDA Commissioner Janet Woodcock, M.D., stresses the ongoing importance of vaccinations and boosters in combating the COVID-19 pandemic, stating, "Expanding booster eligibility to 16- and 17-year-olds is an important step in our efforts to ensure the continued protection of our youth against COVID-19."

This recent authorization for 16- and 17-year-olds follows the FDA's decision on November 19th to authorize booster doses for individuals 18 years of age and older. The Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine and its authorized vaccine, Comirnaty, are the only vaccines currently authorized for use as boosters in the 16- and 17-year-old age group.

Peter Marks, M.D., Ph.D., director of the FDA's Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research, highlights waning vaccine effectiveness over time as the rationale behind recommending boosters. Dr. Marks emphasizes, "Our thorough analysis of immune response data supports the effectiveness of a booster dose in both youth and adults in enhancing protection against COVID-19."

The FDA conducted a comprehensive assessment to determine that the benefits of administering a booster dose to 16- and 17-year-olds outweigh the risks of potential rare side effects such as myocarditis and pericarditis. Pfizer is currently conducting studies to further evaluate the risks of these conditions in individuals within this age group. The FDA and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will continue to closely monitor the safety of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine and its authorized booster.

For this decision, the FDA did not convene the Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee, as the agency's thorough review of available data supported the authorization of boosters for 16- and 17-year-olds. The FDA remains committed to making data-driven decisions in the interest of public health and safety.

Study Confirms Safety and Effectiveness of COVID-19 Vaccines in Real-World Setting

Recent clinical trials have provided strong evidence of the effectiveness and safety of COVID-19 vaccines in preventing severe illness and death caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. A new study published in The New England Journal of Medicine reinforces these findings in a real-world setting, offering valuable insights into vaccine safety and adverse events.

The study, conducted by researchers from the Clalit Research Institute, Harvard Medical School, and the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, analyzed data from nearly 2 million individuals in Israel who received the Pfizer/BioNTech BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine. The research demonstrated few adverse events associated with the vaccine, with myocarditis being identified as a rare side effect. According to the study, the rate of myocarditis was 2.7 excess cases per 100,000 vaccinated people.

Ben Reis, HMS assistant professor of pediatrics and director of the predictive medicine group at the Computational Health Informatics Program at Boston Children's, highlighted the significance of this study in addressing vaccine hesitancy concerns. He stated, "This study provides comprehensive safety information that can help alleviate fears surrounding COVID-19 vaccination."

Ran Balicer, director of the Clalit Research Institute and chairman of Israel's National Expert Advisory Team on COVID-19 response, emphasized the safety of mRNA vaccines compared to the higher risks associated with 'natural' coronavirus infection. Balicer stated, "The benefits of vaccination far outweigh the risks of serious conditions like myocarditis, which are significantly higher among unvaccinated individuals who contract SARS-CoV-2."

The findings of this study are consistent with and add to the results of the Pfizer/BioNTech phase 3 randomized clinical trial, further solidifying the safety profile of the mRNA vaccine. Additionally, a parallel analysis comparing vaccinated and unvaccinated individuals assessed 25 potential adverse events, revealing that while some rare adverse events were moderately associated with vaccination, they were infrequent.

The study underscores the importance of COVID-19 vaccination in preventing severe outcomes linked to the virus while providing critical data on the safety of mRNA vaccines. Researchers and health experts hope that this real-world evidence will help address concerns surrounding vaccine safety and encourage more individuals to get vaccinated to achieve widespread immunity.

As the global community continues its fight against the COVID-19 pandemic, studies like this one play a crucial role in informing public health policies and strategies to control the spread of the virus and protect vulnerable populations. With ongoing research and monitoring of vaccine safety and effectiveness, researchers aim to provide the public with the information needed to make informed decisions about their health and well-being.

The successful passage of EVER ACE signifies the Suez Canal's capability to accommodate giant container ships, further solidifying its position as a key global trade route.

Embarking on its maiden voyage from the Port of Taipei, Taiwan, EVER ACE is en route to Rotterdam, Netherlands, with an expected arrival date of September 4. Suez Canal Blockade Prompts Legal Dispute over General Average Principle

The recent grounding of the Ever Given in the Suez Canal has ignited a significant legal and insurance conflict involving the application of the general average principle. This principle, based on the York Antwerp Rules, necessitates a fair sharing of losses between vessel owners and cargo interests in certain maritime incidents.

General average is typically invoked for various reasons such as vessel fires, overboard containers, salvage operations, or seeking refuge. Joe Klobus, Claims and Insurance Manager at OEC Group, explains, "It's a longstanding maritime tradition that exists to protect all parties involved in a maritime venture." In this case, the vessel's owners invoked general average, not the specific operator, Evergreen, due to the blockage.

Incidents like containers falling overboard have become more common, leading to an increase in general average declarations. While Evergreen may not bear direct liability, the company is facing a significant public and legal challenge concerning the financial consequences of the Suez Canal blockade.

The $900 million cited by Egyptian authorities in claims against the Ever Given encompasses various components, including $300 million each for a salvage bonus and loss of reputation. Vessels that were delayed due to the Ever Given's grounding are unlikely to be able to declare general average, as delay does not align with the York Antwerp Rules' criteria.

Shippers engaging in maritime contracts should be aware of general average, although many may not fully grasp its implications. Klobus highlights that this principle can have far-reaching effects on the market: "If charges related to the Ever Given and other similar incidents are passed down to shippers, they could ultimately impact consumer prices as these costs get rolled into landed costs."

The aftermath of the Suez Canal blockage underscores the importance of understanding and navigating the intricate legal and financial intricacies of the maritime industry. As incidents disrupting global supply chains become more common, adherence to maritime laws and regulations, including general average, is crucial for all stakeholders involved in international trade.

World Health Organization Designates B.1.1.529 Variant as Omicron, a Variant of Concern

The Technical Advisory Group on SARS-CoV-2 Virus Evolution (TAG-VE) met on 26 November 2021 to assess the B.1.1.529 variant, first reported to the World Health Organization (WHO) by South Africa on 24 November 2021. The earliest known infection linked to this variant dates back to 9 November 2021. This variant has raised significant concerns due to its large number of mutations, prompting preliminary evidence suggesting an increased risk of reinfection.

In South Africa, cases of the B.1.1.529 variant, now designated as Omicron by WHO, are on the rise across almost all provinces. This rapid spread has captured the attention of global health authorities. Despite the mutations in this variant, current SARS-CoV-2 PCR diagnostics have shown the ability to detect Omicron. Specifically, the S gene target failure in one PCR test can act as an indicator for the presence of this variant.

Following the thorough assessment by the TAG-VE, the recommendation was made to designate B.1.1.529 as a Variant of Concern (VOC) and assign it the name Omicron. WHO has communicated this designation to member states and will continue to provide updates as new information becomes available. It is crucial that countries enhance surveillance measures, increase sequencing efforts, and promptly report any cases associated with VOC infections.

Individuals worldwide are reminded of the importance of adhering to public health measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Additionally, getting vaccinated remains a key strategy in protecting oneself and others from severe illness and potential variants of the virus, including Omicron. Vaccination campaigns should continue to be prioritized to increase global immunity and curb the transmission of the virus.

It is essential to reiterate the definitions of SARS-CoV-2 variants for clarity. Variants of Interest (VOIs) are those with genetic changes that may affect virus characteristics, such as transmissibility, disease severity, or immune escape. Variants of Concern (VOCs), on the other hand, have been shown to pose a higher public health risk, requiring more focused attention and potentially additional countermeasures.

As the situation with the Omicron variant unfolds, WHO urges countries to remain vigilant and transparent in reporting cases and sharing data. Rapid and coordinated efforts are necessary to understand the potential impact of this variant on transmissibility, severity of illness, and effectiveness of vaccines and treatments.

Global solidarity and collaboration are essential in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic. WHO will continue to work closely with partners to monitor and respond to the evolving situation with the Omicron variant. Fact Check: Republicans' Claims Blaming Biden for Gas and Lumber Costs Are Misleading

WASHINGTON (AP) â€“ House Republican leaders have recently pointed fingers at President Joe Biden, accusing his policies of driving up gasoline and lumber costs in the United States. However, a closer look at the facts reveals that these assertions are misleading and not entirely based on reality.

The recent spike in gas prices is not because of Biden's policies, as House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy suggested. The primary reason for the increase in gas prices can be traced back to the cyberattack on the Colonial Pipeline, which disrupted fuel supplies along the East Coast. This cyberattack, not Biden's actions, led to temporary shortages and price hikes at the pump.

Furthermore, the current shortages and price increases in various sectors, including lumber, are mainly a result of the challenges in restarting the U.S. and global economies after the devastating impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. These difficulties are not solely the consequence of Biden's policy decisions.

Claims connecting Biden's cancellation of the Keystone XL pipeline to the current gasoline prices are also misleading. It's important to note that the Keystone XL pipeline was designed to transport crude oil, not gasoline. Therefore, any impact on gasoline prices from the cancellation would be indirect at best.

Gas prices have risen due to a rapid rebound in demand as pandemic restrictions ease and people resume travel. "Prices at the pump have been driven by the colonial pipeline shutdown that led to a brief spike in prices," said Patrick DeHaan, head of petroleum analysis for GasBuddy.

Comparing current gas prices with those from last year can be misleading, as gas prices in 2020 plummeted due to the global economic slowdown caused by the pandemic, not because of the policies of the Trump administration.

Despite the Colonial Pipeline being back in operation, some states are still experiencing gas shortages following the cyberattack. The disruptions caused by the attack continue to impact fuel supplies in certain areas, which is contributing to the lingering effects on gas prices.

Turning to lumber prices, the surge in costs can be attributed to increased demand and a sharp economic rebound, not Biden's policies as implied by some Republicans. "The lumber situation is completely based on a massive surge in demand with the pandemic placing enormous restrictions on how many people could work at building sites," noted Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming.

The accusation made by Ronna McDaniel, head of the Republican National Committee, that Biden's policies are responsible for a 400% increase in lumber prices is unfounded. Rising prices in commodities like lumber are partly due to strong consumer demand for goods, which is actually a positive sign indicating a recovering economy.

In conclusion, while there are legitimate concerns about rising costs in various sectors, direct blame solely on President Biden's policies is not supported by the facts. The true reasons behind the increases in gas and lumber prices are multifaceted and largely tied to the challenges experienced during the economic recovery post-pandemic.

Impeachment Beyond Term's End: Lessons from Senator William Blount for Trump's Trial

The ongoing debate surrounding the impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump has prompted discussions about the historical precedent of impeaching and trying a federal official after they have left office. One such historical case that sheds light on this issue is that of Senator William Blount, whose impeachment and trial serve as a notable example of post-office accountability.

Senator William Blount, a prominent figure in the early days of the United States, found himself at the center of the Senate's first impeachment case in 1797. Blount was expelled from the Senate and subsequently impeached for his involvement in a scheme to incite a Native American uprising against Spanish territories in Florida and Louisiana, with the intention of benefiting Great Britain.

Drawing a parallel to the current discussions surrounding Trump's impeachment trial after his presidency, legal experts emphasize that the process of impeaching and trying a federal official does not necessarily end when the official leaves office. As Jonathan Turley, a professor at George Washington University, notes, "Being impeached does not mean the end of a political career."

Blount's case, however, did not follow the typical course of an impeachment trial. The Senate dismissed the case on jurisdictional grounds, as Blount did not attend his trial. Stewart Harris, a constitutional law professor and board member at the Blount Mansion with Lincoln Memorial University, points out that the Senate has the flexibility to conduct an impeachment trial whenever it chooses.

While some of Trump's supporters argue that impeachment could prevent him from holding future federal office, Blount's case does not directly support this theory. Despite his impeachment and the subsequent dismissal of the case, Blount's political career continued in Tennessee, indicating that impeachment may not permanently harm a political figure's future prospects.

In addition to Blount, the case of Secretary of War William Belknap provides another relevant precedent for post-office impeachment. Belknap resigned from his position amidst allegations of bribery and was subsequently impeached by the House of Representatives. The trial in the Senate proceeded, even though Belknap had left office, leading to his acquittal.

Fact Check: No, the military did not raid Facebook to cause the recent outage

A widespread claim suggesting that the military raided Facebook and caused its recent outage by seizing servers has been debunked. The outage, which affected Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp for about six hours on October 4, was attributed to human error during routine maintenance, not a military intervention as some posts online have suggested.

Facebook, the parent company of the three social media platforms, experienced a global outage that left users unable to access their accounts or post content for several hours. Stephon Rudd, a Facebook user, shared the claim on social media, stating, "I heard that the military took down Facebook and that's why it was down all day. Can you believe that?"

However, Santosh Janardhan, Vice President of Infrastructure at Facebook, provided an explanation for the outage, attributing it to human error. An engineer issued a command that unintentionally disrupted Facebook's global data center connections. This mistake was compounded by an audit tool that was supposed to prevent such errors, but failed to stop the erroneous command from executing.

The outage was further exacerbated as Facebook was removed from the Domain Name System (DNS) servers. This hindered the company's internal investigation and resolution tools, delaying the restoration process. Engineers had to manually restart systems at various data centers, which was also prolonged by necessary security measures.

In response to the claim circulating online about a military raid, Tom Parnell, Communications Manager at Facebook, directly refuted the theory. He pointed to the explanation provided by Janardhan, stating that the outage was caused by human error during routine maintenance and not by any military intervention.

The Department of Defense was contacted for a response regarding the claim, which has been categorically denied. Based on the facts provided by Facebook's representatives, there is no evidence to support the claim of a military raid causing the recent outage.

Janardhan emphasized the company's commitment to addressing the root cause of the outage and implementing measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. He acknowledged the impact the outage had on users globally and expressed Facebook's regret for the inconvenience caused.

While speculation and rumors can quickly spread on social media platforms, it is essential to rely on verified information provided by credible sources. In this instance, Facebook has clarified the circumstances surrounding the outage, debunking the unfounded claim of a military raid as the cause.

Guide to Returning Stimulus Payments: What You Need to Know

Over 161 million third stimulus check payments have been distributed, providing much-needed financial relief to Americans during the ongoing pandemic. These payments also include 'plus-up payments' for individuals who did not receive the full amount they were eligible for based on their 2020 tax return.

However, not all recipients will get to keep the stimulus money they received. If someone received a payment in error or was overpaid, they may have to return the funds to the IRS. How the money should be returned varies depending on the payment method used â€“ whether it was a paper check, an Economic Impact Payment (EIP) card, or a direct deposit.

The income cutoffs for the third round of stimulus checks are $80,000 for individuals, $120,000 for heads of household, and $160,000 for married couples filing jointly. If someone's income exceeded these thresholds in 2020, they might have to repay some or all of the stimulus money they received. However, if their income increased in 2020 and they received a payment before filing their taxes, they may not have to return the funds.

Certain groups of individuals are ineligible to receive stimulus payments. This includes the deceased, nonresidents without a US citizen spouse, noncitizens who do not have a Social Security number and do not file federal taxes, dependents, and individuals who received duplicate payments.

For deceased family members who received a stimulus payment, whether the money needs to be returned depends on the filer status and the tax year the payment was based on. Instructions provided by the IRS outline the steps for returning cashed or deposited checks. Recipients are required to make payments payable to the US Treasury and notify the IRS of the repayment.

If the stimulus payment received was a paper check that has not been cashed or deposited, individuals should write "VOID" on the back and return the check to the IRS along with an explanation for why it wasn't cashed. It is essential to follow these procedures to ensure the proper return of any unnecessary payments.

Those who did not receive their first or second stimulus payments may still be able to claim them as a Recovery Credit Rebate on their 2020 tax return. By filing a tax return, individuals can reconcile any missing stimulus funds they were eligible for but did not receive.

As the IRS continues to distribute stimulus payments and provide guidance on returning funds when necessary, it is crucial for recipients to stay informed and follow the outlined procedures to avoid any issues with their stimulus funds.

Facebook Outage: How BGP Errors Led to a Global Service Disruption

On Monday, social media giant Facebook, along with its sister platforms Instagram and WhatsApp, experienced a widespread outage that left millions of users around the world unable to access their accounts. The unprecedented outage, lasting several hours, was initially attributed to issues with the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), a critical system that helps direct internet traffic efficiently.

BGP acts as a digital map, guiding data packets across various autonomous systems that make up the internet to ensure they reach their intended destination. These autonomous systems can range from internet service providers (ISPs) to large companies and even governmental organizations. Just like outdated or incorrect directions on a physical map can lead drivers astray, errors in BGP configuration can misroute internet traffic, causing communication breakdowns.

The root cause of Facebook's outage was revealed to be a 'configuration change on the backbone routers,' which triggered a cascading failure in communication between the company's data centers. While Facebook has its own BGP system in place to facilitate speedy updates within its vast network of data centers, this particular disruption was more about internal communication breakdowns rather than external routing issues.

In addition to BGP, another crucial component of the internet's infrastructure is the Domain Name System (DNS). While BGP focuses on finding the best path for data packets to travel, DNS is responsible for translating human-readable domain names (like facebook.com) into the numerical IP addresses that computers use to communicate. Both systems work in tandem to ensure smooth and efficient internet traffic flow.

Past incidents involving BGP errors have caused significant disruptions across the internet. In some cases, ISPs have accidentally hijacked traffic meant for other destinations, while in others, global access to popular websites such as YouTube has been temporarily severed. These mishaps underscore the importance of properly configuring and maintaining BGP settings to prevent widespread outages.

Ultimately, the Facebook outage was determined to be the result of a maintenance error that led to a loss of connectivity between the company's data centers, rather than a direct consequence of BGP misconfigurations. While BGP errors can indeed have far-reaching implications for internet connectivity, in this instance, the issue stemmed from internal communication challenges within Facebook's infrastructure.

As internet users and businesses increasingly rely on seamless online connectivity for communication, commerce, and social interactions, the need for robust systems like BGP to function flawlessly becomes more critical. The recent Facebook outage serves as a stark reminder of the intricate web of technologies that underpin our digital lives and the potential disruptions that can occur when these systems falter.

Falsey, M.D., Professor of Medicine at the University of Rochester School of Medicine in New York.

The vaccine's efficacy was consistent across different ethnicities, and it was found to be effective in participants 65 years and older. "The high efficacy rates and safety profile of the AZD1222 vaccine are encouraging and bode well for its potential as a key tool in the fight against the pandemic," commented Magdalena E. Sobieszczyk, M.D., Associate Professor of Medicine at Columbia University Medical Center in New York.

Importantly, there was no increased risk of thrombotic events or cerebral venous sinus thrombosis observed among vaccinated participants. This finding further supports the safety profile of the AZD1222 vaccine. The World Health Organization has recommended the use of the vaccine, which is currently available in over 70 countries worldwide.

AZD1222 utilizes a non-replicating chimpanzee adenovirus to deliver the genetic code of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein to human cells, triggering an immune response. The COVID-19 Prevention Network (CoVPN) played a critical role in enrolling volunteers for the clinical trial, which will continue to follow participants for about two years after their second injection to gather additional data for further study.

Scott Perrien, a Hydrologist with the US Geological Survey, explains, "Warmer atmospheric temperatures due to climate change are increasing the moisture content in the air, allowing hurricanes to unleash heavier rainfall and causing more severe flooding during these events."

The convergence of heavy rainfall and rising sea levels has also contributed to the escalation of storm surges accompanying hurricanes. Paul Miller, a Coastal Meteorology Scientist at Louisiana State University, points out, "Sea level rise is heightening the risk of storm surges, amplifying the destructive power of hurricanes like Ida as they push water further inland." The disappearance of Louisiana's coastal wetlands, which act as a natural barrier against storm surges, further exacerbates the vulnerability of the region to such extreme weather events.

Experts emphasize the urgent need for swift action to address the root causes of climate change and mitigate its impact on hurricane severity. Rapid greenhouse gas emission reductions are essential to curbing the escalating risks posed by more intense and destructive hurricanes. Opinion: Behind the Scenes of Firearms Safety on Movie Sets: A Closer Look at the 'Rust' Tragedy

In the world of filmmaking, safety is paramount, especially when it comes to handling firearms on set. Multiple steps and rigorous safety measures are in place to ensure that accidents involving guns are avoided at all costs. However, the recent tragic shooting on the set of 'Rust' has brought renewed attention to the risks involved in working with firearms on film productions.

The fatal incident that resulted in the loss of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and the injury of director Joel Souza on the 'Rust' movie set is both incredibly rare and undeniably tragic. As a union armorer specializing in Westerns, Joey Dillon sheds light on the complex process of preparing and using firearms on set to debunk misinformation and speculation surrounding the 'Rust' tragedy.

Contrary to popular belief, most firearms used in movies are real and require extensive paperwork, permits, and strict monitoring to ensure their safe use on set. The use of blank rounds, often misunderstood by the general public, is a crucial aspect of simulating gunfire in films. Dillon explains, "Blank rounds are cartridges that contain gunpowder but lack a bullet. They create the sound and muzzle flash necessary for realistic gunfire effects without firing a projectile."

On a movie set, revolvers are commonly used due to their historical significance and popularity in Westerns. When using blank rounds in a revolver, strict safety protocols must be followed. Dillon elaborates, "Before any scene involving gunfire, the armorer ensures that the firearm is loaded with the correct type of blank rounds. Additionally, dummy rounds, which are inert cartridges without gunpowder or primers, are often used for close-up shots or scenes where the gun is shown being loaded."

Safety measures on set go beyond just loading the correct ammunition. Actor training, rehearsals with "cold" guns (unloaded firearms), checking for obstructions in the gun barrel, and the use of protective gear are all standard practices to prevent accidents. Dillon emphasizes the importance of having multiple crew members dedicated to firearm safety, including the armorer, weapons handlers, and on-set safety personnel.

Live rounds, or ammunition capable of firing a projectile, are typically prohibited on movie sets due to the inherent dangers they pose. However, there are rare exceptions for educational scenarios where live firing may be necessary. In such cases, strict protocols are observed, including checking to ensure the chambers are empty and declaring the gun "hot" to alert everyone on set that it's loaded with live ammunition.

Joey Dillon, a seasoned union armorer and expert gun handler based in Los Angeles, emphasizes the meticulous attention to detail and safety protocols that are ingrained in the film industry. "As professionals, our top priority is always the safety of everyone on set. We undergo rigorous training and certification to ensure that every firearm is handled responsibly and that safety protocols are followed to the letter," Dillon states.

The tragic events on the 'Rust' set serve as a sobering reminder of the risks involved in working with firearms in the entertainment industry. While accidents are rare, the consequences can be devastating. As investigations into the incident continue, it is crucial for the film industry to reaffirm its commitment to safety and to learn from this tragedy to prevent similar incidents in the future.

In conclusion, the 'Rust' tragedy has sparked important conversations about firearm safety on movie sets. By understanding the meticulous processes involved in handling firearms, debunking misconceptions, and emphasizing the importance of stringent safety measures, we can hopefully prevent such heartbreaking incidents from occurring again. The film industry must continue to prioritize safety above all else to ensure that every cast and crew member can work in a secure and protected environment.

Understanding the Differences Between Single and Double Dose COVID-19 Vaccines

As the global vaccination efforts against COVID-19 continue, different vaccines offer various dosing schedules. The Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines require two doses, separated by 3 and 4 weeks respectively, to achieve full efficacy. These vaccines use mRNA technology to stimulate the immune system to recognize and fight the virus. Full immunity is typically reached about 2 weeks following the second dose, with Pfizer-BioNTech boasting a 95% effectiveness rate and Moderna at 94.1%.

On the other hand, the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only requires a single dose for full vaccination. This vaccine is based on a viral vector platform and has shown to be 66.3% effective at preventing moderate to severe COVID-19. However, discussions have arisen regarding the potential benefits of delaying or eliminating the second dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines to expand coverage. While initial immunity is observed after the first dose, complete protection is achieved after the second dose, significantly boosting effectiveness.

Health authorities like the CDC recommend adhering to the specific dosing schedules for each vaccine. Although the CDC allows for a slight window in administering the second dose earlier or within 6 weeks of the first dose in certain situations, experts advise sticking to the recommended timelines for optimal protection. Additionally, mixing different vaccine brands, like Pfizer and Moderna, is not advised as the same product should be used for both doses to ensure the most effective immune response against COVID-19. These nuances highlight the importance of following vaccination guidelines to maximize immunity and combat the spread of the virus effectively.

Phase 3 Trial Shows Novavax COVID-19 Vaccine Demonstrates High Efficacy

The results of the Phase 3 clinical trial for the Novavax COVID-19 vaccine, known as NVX-CoV2373, have been released, showing promising outcomes. The vaccine has demonstrated an impressive 90.4% efficacy in preventing symptomatic COVID-19. Even more encouraging is the fact that NVX-CoV2373 provided 100% protection against moderate and severe disease caused by the virus.

The most common side effects reported during the trial were mild-to-moderate injection site pain, fatigue, headache, and muscle pain. These side effects were typically short-lived, lasting less than two days, and were well-tolerated by the participants involved in the study.

The PREVENT-19 trial, funded by the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) and the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), enrolled nearly 30,000 volunteers in the United States and Mexico. The trial utilized a 2:1 ratio for the distribution of the vaccine to placebo, and the study was conducted in a blinded fashion to ensure that both participants and investigators remained unaware of who received the vaccine.

The efficacy results of NVX-CoV2373 were based on 77 symptomatic COVID-19 cases observed during the trial, with 63 cases occurring in the placebo group compared to just 14 cases in the vaccine group. Fact Check: Rep. Nadler's Claim About Kyle Rittenhouse Crossing State Lines Armed is False

Representative Jerry Nadler recently made a statement suggesting that Kyle Rittenhouse, acquitted for the Kenosha shootings during the 2020 unrest, crossed state lines armed before the tragic events unfolded.
